description: In this course, we explore some more advanced features of PowerPoint 2016. We start with digging deeper into PowerPoint options, customizing the interface, and exploring advanced file properties including accessibility and security. Other topics include modifying the all-important slide master, adding external content such as Excel data into slides as linked objects, inserting audio and video, and collaborating with others both online and offline. We finish up the series with customizing the delivery of presentations with custom shows, hyperlinks, and Zoom.

name: Advanced PowerPoint 2016
subtitle: Presentation application to create slide shows

episodes.description: In this course, we explore some more advanced features of PowerPoint 2016. We start with digging deeper into PowerPoint options, customizing the interface, and exploring advanced file properties including accessibility and security. Other topics include modifying the all-important slide master, adding external content such as Excel data into slides as linked objects, inserting audio and video, and collaborating with others both online and offline. We finish up the series with customizing the delivery of presentations with custom shows, hyperlinks, and Zoom.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:06.021
[NOISE] Hey,
did you guys enjoy that PowerPoint 2016?

2
00:00:06.021 --> 00:00:11.264
Great news, cuz we got another course
coming your way, Advanced PowerPoint 2016.

3
00:00:11.264 --> 00:00:14.590
Here to tell us all about it and what
we're gonna learn is Miss Vonne Smith.

4
00:00:14.590 --> 00:00:15.396
>> Thank you Mike.

5
00:00:15.396 --> 00:00:19.292
Yes, we're going to be taking a little bit
deeper dive into PowerPoint and really

6
00:00:19.292 --> 00:00:22.972
start getting into the nitty gritties of
PowerPoint and what it can do for us.

7
00:00:22.972 --> 00:00:25.850
So we're just gonna take it a little
bit further in this series.

8
00:00:25.850 --> 00:00:28.722
We're gonna get into
customizing our interface.

9
00:00:28.722 --> 00:00:31.242
We're gonna be creating our own
tabs in the ribbon this time,

10
00:00:31.242 --> 00:00:33.060
instead of using whatever is there.

11
00:00:33.060 --> 00:00:36.128
We're going to also be talking
about advanced file features, or

12
00:00:36.128 --> 00:00:38.986
advanced file properties such
as inspecting our document.

13
00:00:38.986 --> 00:00:42.933
And talking about some important features
like accessibility, and making sure that

14
00:00:42.933 --> 00:00:47.230
we have the PowerPoint ready for the right
audience that we're going to be serving.

15
00:00:47.230 --> 00:00:49.340
We're also gonna be jumping
into that Slide Master,

16
00:00:49.340 --> 00:00:52.240
the all important Slide Master
that rules them all, and

17
00:00:52.240 --> 00:00:56.860
being able to control that, and be able to
really get a good handle on our PowerPoint

18
00:00:56.860 --> 00:00:59.480
presentation the way that
we want it to be formatted.

19
00:00:59.480 --> 00:01:04.070
We're also going to be linking to external
content from other Office products and

20
00:01:04.070 --> 00:01:08.060
be able to link and embed content
into the PowerPoint presentation.

21
00:01:08.060 --> 00:01:10.290
We're also gonna be adding some video and
some audio.

22
00:01:10.290 --> 00:01:14.092
So you'll be seeing more of Fuego and
Bishop, [LAUGH] and our wonderful cats.

23
00:01:14.092 --> 00:01:17.419
We're also gonna be talking about
different ways that we're going to be

24
00:01:17.419 --> 00:01:19.339
collaborating with other individuals.

25
00:01:19.339 --> 00:01:24.077
And with some of the neat new features
that they have in the cloud using

26
00:01:24.077 --> 00:01:26.779
OneDrive and our use of Office 365.

27
00:01:26.779 --> 00:01:30.343
Then we're gonna finish it all up with
how we can create some custom PowerPoint

28
00:01:30.343 --> 00:01:31.159
presentations.

29
00:01:31.159 --> 00:01:34.376
And how we can customize what
slides we're going to be using, and

30
00:01:34.376 --> 00:01:38.354
be able to really utilize the different
ways that we can hyperlink to things, and

31
00:01:38.354 --> 00:01:42.035
create action buttons, and
have for our different audiences.

32
00:01:42.035 --> 00:01:46.033
So if that sounds like fun, I hope you
stay tuned, and let's jump right in.

33
00:01:46.033 --> 00:01:49.544
[SOUND]

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at the ways that you can customize the user interface in PowerPoint. They demonstrate configuring general settings and account settings. They also look at settings for proofing and saving presentations.
episodes.title: Customize PowerPoint Interface

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike continue their exploration of the customization options in PowerPoint. They look at the advanced options and how to customize the ribbons and quick access toolbar. They also discuss the various options in the Trust Center Settings.
episodes.title: Customize PowerPoint Interface Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike work with the Slide Master in PowerPoint. They demonstrate working with the Slide Master to customize design templates. They also look at creating a custom template that can be reused.
episodes.title: Slide Masters

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike continue to work with the master templates in PowerPoint. They demonstrate how to work with the Notes Master and the Handout Master. Similar to the Slide Master, they show how to customize and save these templates.
episodes.title: Slide Masters Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at several ways to link and embed objects in PowerPoint. They demonstrate linking and embedding objects from Word and Excel, and compare and contrast the two methods. They also look at adding hyperlinks to a presentation.
episodes.title: Link and Embed External Content

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike demonstrate how to package a PowerPoint presentation. They demonstrate what happens to a PowerPoint presentation with linked or embeded content when not packaged properly. Then they package a PowerPoint presentation properly, to include external content.
episodes.title: Link and Embed External Content Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at how to insert audio and video into a PowerPoint presentation. They demonstrate adding an audio clip, as well as adding a looping background audio track. Then they demonstrate adding video clips, both local and linking to an online video.
episodes.title: Audio and Video

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike continue their look at inserting audio and video into a PowerPoint presentation. They demonstrate adding video clips, both local and linking to an online video. They also show how to prepare a slideshow for distribution and add narration to a presentation.
episodes.title: Audio and Video Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike discuss collaboration methods in PowerPoint 2016. They look at adding comments and highlighting with the Inking feature. They also demonstrate using the compare option to find changes that were not commented.
episodes.title: Comment and Compare

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at using OneDrive to collaborate on a PowerPoint presentation. They demonstrate uploading a presentation to the cloud, and various ways to give others access.
episodes.title: Collaborate in the Cloud

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike discuss creating custom shows in PowerPoint. They demonstrate how to rehearse timings, adding hyperlinks and action buttons. They also show how to use one presentation for multiple groups by creating custom or 'sub' shows within a presentation, and how to use the zoom function.
episodes.title: Custom Shows

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Mike look at file metadata and other advanced file properties. They discuss adding tags and categories to help find a file. They demonstrate inspecting a document to look for off-slide content, notes or other information that we might want to remove. They also look at accessibility options, compatibility options, and how to protect a presentation.
episodes.title: Advanced File Properties
